1.text: As dead flies bring a stench to the perfumer’s oil, so a little folly outweighs wisdom and honor.

2.text: A wise man’s heart inclines to the right, but the heart of a fool to the left.

3.text: Even as the fool walks along the road, his sense is lacking, and he shows everyone that he is a fool.

4.text: If the ruler’s temper flares against you, do not abandon your post, for calmness lays great offenses to rest.

5.text: There is an evil I have seen under the sun—an error that proceeds from the ruler:

6.text: Folly is appointed to great heights, but the rich sit in lowly positions.

7.text: I have seen slaves on horseback, while princes go on foot like slaves.

8.text: He who digs a pit may fall into it, and he who breaches a wall may be bitten by a snake.

9.text: The one who quarries stones may be injured by them, and he who splits logs endangers himself.

10.text: If the axe is dull and the blade unsharpened, more strength must be exerted, but skill produces success.

11.text: If the snake bites before it is charmed, there is no profit for the charmer.

12.text: The words of a wise man’s mouth are gracious, but the lips of a fool consume him.

13.text: The beginning of his talk is folly, and the end of his speech is evil madness.

14.text: Yet the fool multiplies words. No one knows what is coming, and who can tell him what will come after him?

15.text: The toil of a fool wearies him, for he does not know the way to the city.

16.text: Woe to you, O land whose king is a youth, and whose princes feast in the morning.

17.text: Blessed are you, O land whose king is a son of nobles, and whose princes feast at the proper time—for strength and not for drunkenness.

18.text: Through laziness the roof caves in, and in the hands of the idle, the house leaks.

19.text: A feast is prepared for laughter, and wine makes life merry, but money is the answer for everything.

20.text: Do not curse the king even in your thoughts, or curse the rich even in your bedroom, for a bird of the air may carry your words, and a winged creature may report your speech.
